isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - CRANKCASE (RECONDITIONING)

note.para: The best way to clean the crankcase during engine overhaul is in a chemical bath or "HOT TANK". This removes all carbonous material and mineral deposits which collect in the cooling passages. If the "HOT TANK" is not available, use the following cleaning procedure.

step1.para: Clean all old gasket material from the machined surfaces of the crankcase using a scraper and a sanding block.
Clean the cylinder sleeve bores using soap, water and a nylon brush.
Remove the main oil gallery cup plugs, at the front and rear of the crankcase, as follows:

note.para: Oil gallery cup plugs are 13/16" in diameter. Occasionally, engines are built with oversized galleries requiring 7/8" cup plugs. These plugs can be identified by a diamond with an MP stamped on it. When replacing these cup plugs, be sure to determine if the plug is a standard 13/16" or an oversize 7/8". Refer to the Parts Catalog for the correct service number.

step2.para: Drill a small hole into the cup plug and insert a self tapping sheet metal screw into plug.

Using a small pry bar, pry the plug out. Refer to Figure 7.50
for plug locations.
Use a 13/16" nylon brush, with soap and water to clean the oil galleries.

figure.caption: Figure 7.50. Main Oil Gallery Plug Locations.

step1.para:
Remove the three hex-socket plugs located on the right side of the crankcase ( Figure 7.51
).
With the plugs removed from the crankcase, clean the crankcase as follows:

step2.para: Use a 21 mm (13/16 in.) nylon brush with soap and water to clean the oil galleries.
Clean the cross drillings using a nylon brush with soap and water.
Blow out all oil galleries and cross drillings using filtered compressed air.
Clean all threaded holes using a tap of appropriate size.
Reinstall the four hex-socket plugs on the right side of the crankcase. Use Loctite(r) to seal the threads.

step1.para: Install new main oil gallery cup plugs as follows:

step2.para: Clean mating surfaces on plug and crankcase.
Apply Loctite(r) to the outside edge of the cup plug.
Drive the cup plug in using an arbor approximately 6.4 mm (1/4 in.) smaller in diameter than the plug being installed.

note.para: Effective with S/N 532981 two nylon patch bolts are used to attach the breather opening cover. Installation of non-patch type bolts could result in oil leaks at the cover opening. Refer to Figure 7.51 for cover location.

figure.caption: Figure 7.51. Cross Drilling Plug and Breather Opening Cover Locations.
